sentence: (Video Credit: Fox News) Senate candidate Josh Mandel (R-OH) clapped back at leftist radicals and Black Lives Matter members who interrupted him and demanded that he leave a church in Cleveland because he is white during an off-the-rails debate with Democratic candidate Morgan Harper.
author: Terresa Monroe-Hamilton
title: Marine vet candidate puts BLM crowd in its place after being told to leave debate because he’s white

sentence: Scroll down for video +6 View gallery Senate hopefuls Mike Gibbons, 69, (left, standing) and Josh Mandel, 44, (right) came toe-to-toe at the primary debate after Mandel attacked the father-of-five's financial assets in China, claiming he 'made millions' there +6 View gallery Mandel appeared irritated toward Gibbons - who's wealth ranges anywhere from $83milllion to $286million - said he didn't 'think I made millions off of anything' Gibbons went on to say that former Marine 'didn't know squat' because he's never worked in private sector, to which Mandel replied that he had served two tours in Iraq and told the businessman: 'Don't tell me I haven't worked.'
title: Should've been boring but... Republican Ohio Senate hopefuls and millionaires Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel nearly come to blows during primary debate about Chinese petroleum

sentence: “We all volunteered to serve our country away from our families, putting our lives in danger, so people like Mike Gibbons could make millions.” Gibbons said Mandel initiated the physical aggression and made “several false, petty comments in an attempt to smear the new front-runner.” “Josh Mandel is unhinged, unfit and flailing — because he’s losing,” Gibbons campaign spokesperson Samantha Cotten said.
author: AP and TOI staff
title: Near-fight at Ohio GOP Senate debate between candidates Josh Mandel, Mike Gibbons

sentence: The debate became intense almost as soon as it began as former state treasurer Josh Mandel attacked investment banker Mike Gibbons' business dealings in his opening remarks.
title: Vets Demand Apology After Tense Clash in GOP Debate

sentence: He doesn’t have the temperament, experience, or fortitude to be a U.S. senator and Ohio voters got a firsthand look at just how unprepared Josh Mandel is to be a leader and that will be reflected at the ballot on May 3.” This is all true, but we also imagine Cotten will twist herself into knots justifying Gibbons’s inevitable endorsement of Mandel if he wins the nomination.
author: Stephen Robinson
title: All Fun And Games Until Ohio GOP Senate Candidate Starts Calling Opponent A 'Pussy'

sentence: Washington (CNN)A new television ad from Ohio Republican Senate candidate Josh Mandel is centered on a false claim that Republican primary rival Mike Gibbons, a businessman, said that military service isn't "real work."
author: Daniel Dale
title: Fact check: Ad from Ohio Republican Josh Mandel falsely claims party rival Mike Gibbons said military service isn't real work

sentence: In his most recent video spot, Josh Mandel is seen walking across the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama, where Rev.
author: Sarah Sicard
title: Marine veteran’s campaign ad for US Senate features a bad photoshop job

sentence: While there appears to be a significant color difference between Mandel’s face and his hands in the version that appeared in the campaign ad, this color difference is far less noticeable in the original photograph (at right in the tweet below): You folks asked if Josh Mandel’s campaign photoshopped his head onto a Black man, and I looked for answers.
author: Dan Evon
title: Did Mandel ‘Forget To Photoshop His Hands’ in Campaign Ad?

sentence: Fact-checkers have pushed back on the accusation that Ohio Senate candidate Josh Mandel photoshopped himself into an image included in one of his ads.
author: Gustaf Kilander
title: Photo filter blamed as Ohio Senate candidate accused of photoshop in ad

sentence: U.S. Senate candidate Josh Mandel drew swift condemnation this week after he filmed a campaign ad attacking critical race theory against the backdrop of a civil rights landmark in Selma, Alabama.
author: Haley BeMiller
title: No, Josh Mandel did not edit his face onto a Black Marine in his new U.S. Senate ad
